meanings.definition: Feeling deep pleasure or satisfaction as a result of one's own achievements, qualities, or possessions.
meanings.sent1: She felt prouder than ever after winning the race.
meanings.sent2: He was prouder of his artwork than anything else.
meanings.sent3: The cat looked prouder than a peacock after catching the mouse.
meanings.sent4: Her smile shone prouder than the sun on a summer day.
meanings.sent5: The trophy made her feel prouder than a queen on her throne.

meanings.definition: Having or displaying a high or excessively high opinion of oneself; having a high opinion of one's own dignity, importance, or superiority.
meanings.sent1: He became prouder as he received more compliments.
meanings.sent2: She always acts prouder than everyone else in the room.
meanings.sent3: The peacock seemed prouder than a lion in the jungle.
meanings.sent4: His ego was prouder than a peacock's display.
meanings.sent5: Her arrogance made her seem prouder than a king in his castle.
